original: Levinsson, Gustaf Paul, elverkschef, Halmstad, f. 25/3/96 i Bottnaryd, Jön-köp. 1. G. 22 m. AHce Peterson. Barn r Bengt Gustav f. 23, M:aj Alice 27, Bo Göran 33. — Studrex. i Jönköp. 15, ex. v. KTH (elrtekn.) 19. Res. s. värnpl. ing. m. pansarkryss. Fylgia t. USA o. Västind. 19-20, s. Sv. elverksfören. stip. t. Holl. 33, t. Tyskl. 35 o. 37, Österr., Ital. o. Jugoslav. 37. Tekn. förest, f. Sala .stads elverk 21-31, lär. i elrtekn. v. Bergsl. verkmr- o. tekni-kersk. i Sala 21-25, chef f. Halmstads elverk sed. 31. Led. av o. v. ordf. i Sala stads vattenledn rstyr. 26-31, ordf. i Halmstads komm rtj rmannafören. sed. 39, ing rf ören. sed. 42 o. tj rmannafören. 46, led. av styr. f. FERA 32. Medl. av Rotarykl. Skr. r art. i Sv. elverksfören. handl. o. i facktidskr. ERA.
translated: Levinsson, Gustaf Paul, power plant manager, Halmstad, b. 25/3/96 in Bottnaryd, Jönköping. 1st marriage with Alice Peterson, they had children: Bengt Gustav, b. 23, Maja Alice, b. 27, Bo Göran, b. 33. - Studied in Jönköping for 15 years, graduated from KTH (Electrical Engineering) in 1919. Served as reserve military engineer with armored cruiser Fylgia to the USA and the West Indies in 1919-1920. Received Swedish Electric Power Association scholarship to the Netherlands in 1933, to Germany in 1935 and 1937, and to Austria, Italy, and Yugoslavia in 1937. Technical manager of Sala city power plant from 1921 to 1931, teaching electrical engineering at the Bergslagen Industrial and Technical School in Sala from 1921 to 1925, and chief of Halmstad power plant since 1931. Member and former chairman of the Sala city water supply board from 1926 to 1931, chairman of the Halmstad municipal workers' association since 1939, member of the engineers' association since 1942, and member of the board of FERA since 1932. Also a member of the Rotary Club. Wrote articles in the Swedish Electric Power Association proceedings and in the professional journal ERA.
